intro: Grias maranonensis, commonly known as the Maranonensis Caperilla, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and thrives in the undergrowth of dense forests. Its botanical features include a shrub-like structure with woody stems and alternate leaves. Grias maranonensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to the humid and competitive rainforest ecosystem.
